column1: Search the Library Catalogue and Community Database

You can use the links below to search for books and publications held in the Libraries, or find organisations and groups based in Tameside. You can also add your organisation or group to our database.
<table cellpadding="10" width="100%" summary="online transactions for libraries">
Enter the Author, title or subject of the item you want to find.
Enter the groups name or activity you want to find - eg. Scouts.
Go to member functions login to renew your books and reserve items via the library catalogue.
This year Tameside Libraries are running lots of different workshops, events and taster sessions from Saturday, 19th May to Friday, 25th May.
All sessions are free and fun, with some aimed at adults and some family friendly events that welcome accompanied children too.
View the Learn in Libraries Week Events.
• Encyclopaedia Britannica
• News UK
• Oxford Dictionary of National Biography
• Oxford English Dictionary
• Oxford Reference Online
Find out more about our online library services...

Hyde Library is being transformed into Tameside's 2nd flagship Library. The first phase of the refurbishment started in September. We envisage that the refurbishment will be completed in Spring 2007. During this period some books and backfiles of newspapers and magazines may not be available. Please contact the Library before visiting if you require a specific item.
Learn at the Library this Winter
We run computer classes in Libraries across Tameside. Classes include Internet & Email, Word, Spreadsheets, Family History and Absolute Beginners classes.
Final score for the Dream Goal

Our football themed campaign, The Dream Goal is nearly at an end. Have a look at The Dream Goal website to find out what went on, who won the competitions, which teams got to design new kits, meet our seven Tameside Dream Goal Reading Champions and read some football poems written by Tameside children and the football poets that visited us during the Summer.
Libraries hold lots of events for children and adults including storytimes, craft activities, author visits, readers groups, library clubs, lectures and coffee mornings.
Look at the Tameside Events Calendar for a full listing of our forthcoming events
We run Readers' Groups all over Tameside and always welcome new members. Join a group near you...
Enter the webzone for the best books, games, homework help and info about your favourite authors...
Books to go
Too busy to choose books? Let our expert staff help. Find out more about Books to go our ground breaking service for busy people.

Tell others about the books you love or loathe! Join our eReaders Group and discuss a different book or theme each month or use Book Reviews and Recommendations to tell others about any books (fiction or non-fiction) that you have enjoyed- or that you think should go into Room 101!.

The New Libraries for Tameside report 121.39 KB has been agreed by the Council. The full results of the consultation for New Libraries for Tameside are listed in appendix 6 of the Cabinet report. 291.1 KB Work has started on putting the recommendations in place. Read more about the latest developments.
BBC RaW
Tameside Libraries are taking part in the BBC RaW campaign to help you enjoy reading and writing more. You can find out more and get free access to the RaW web site in all our libraries.
Do You Love Libraries?

Love libraries is a campaign to get everyone excited about what public libraries can do for readers and how we can make them better! Visit www.lovelibraries.co.uk to have your say on 21st century reading services.

People's Network services help everyone to make the most of the online world: to enquire, discover and read online for free 24/7 from anywhere with access to the web. Tameside Libraries is part of the People's Network.
Still not found what you are looking for? Try our Search or our A to Z of Services:
